title: JOB
description: JSON schema for assuring that an instance of transported data about a JOB entity is fit for intended consumption

ENTITY.title: PROPERTY
ENTITY.description: JSON schema for assuring that transported data about a PROPERTY is fit for intended consumption

address_line_1.$comment: First line of full MHRC-VOA property address

address_postcode.$comment: Post code of property held by HMRC-VOA

address_known_as.$comment: Alternative property address or part thereof assisting the property's indetification

ENTITY.title: PERSON
ENTITY.description: JSON schema for assuring that transported data about a PERSON is fit for intended consumption

title_common.$comment: Generally accepted prefixes denoting marital status.

title_uncommon.$comment: All other prefixes avered by person concerned. (https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/titles-included-in-passports/titles-accessible)

forenames.$comment: Registered name and/or given name plus any middle names (if any).

post_nominals.$comment: Any characters dentoting state hounors, professional titles or professional qualifications to be shown after surname.

corporate_name.$comment: The proclaimed name of a legally registered, statutorily constituted or royally chartered body corporate.

crown_name.$comment: The pronounced name of a royally appointed, commisioned or otherwise devised state office or officer. Including the monarch, government, judicial or armed forces role.

known_as.$comment: Any accepted abbreviation, conflation, representation of or alternative to the authorative naming feilds; Including in the case of legally recognosed partners, the legally proclaimed firm name; And in the case of a company any trading name.

ENTITY.title: PERSON
ENTITY.description: JSON schema for assuring that transported data about a PERSON is fit for intended consumption

title_common.$comment: Generally accepted prefixes denoting marital status.

title_uncommon.$comment: All other prefixes avered by person concerned. (https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/titles-included-in-passports/titles-accessible)

forenames.$comment: Registered name and/or given name plus any middle names (if any).

post_nominals.$comment: Any characters dentoting state hounors, professional titles or professional qualifications to be shown after surname.

corporate_name.$comment: The proclaimed name of a legally registered, statutorily constituted or royally chartered body corporate.

crown_name.$comment: The pronounced name of a royally appointed, commisioned or otherwise devised state office or officer. Including the monarch, government, judicial or armed forces role.

known_as.$comment: Any accepted abbreviation, conflation, representation of or alternative to the authorative naming feilds; Including in the case of legally recognosed partners, the legally proclaimed firm name; And in the case of a company any trading name.
